Normally, you can hear thunder from 6 to 10 miles from a lightning strike. Since lightning can strike outward more than 10 miles from a thunderstorm, if you hear thunder, you are likely within striking distance. BEWARE! Returning to # Medina from the east this afternoon, we witnessed a brilliant cloud/ground lightning strike nearby: NOT under a storm, NO rain, NO wind. Lightning can reach out many miles from the center of a thunderstorm and the atmosphere is primed for action! Take cover.

Boaters should be aware of the dangers of lightning while out on the water. A lightning strike to a vessel can be catastrophic, especially if it results in a fire or loss of electronics. Use extra caution when thunderstorm conditions exist. # LightningSafety # MDFRSafetypic.twitter.com/3V3B6NSbGS

Normally, you can hear thunder from 6 to 10 miles from a lightning strike. Since lightning can strike outward more than 10 miles from a thunderstorm, if you hear thunder, you are likely within striking distance.
